TopicTitle: [0.23.5] Spherical and Toroidal Tank Pack (Updated 05/02/14) (New download link)

Articles.Content: These fuel tanks are awesome!

You can change it in the config file, that's what I've done. You can look at the stock version for inspiration

I could be wrong, but I think the mass of the couplers is to help keep the tank from wobbling off of the attachment points. I seem to remember in another parts thread about how changing the mass of parts to be lower actually causes the physics system in KSP to treat attachment nodes as weaker.

What I've been told is that the wobble on a joint between two parts is determined based on their relative masses, the breakForce and breakTorque only relate to under what conditions the joint fails entirely.

I just looked through this whole thread and i am shocked that NOBODY made THIS:

some of my designs incorporating the tanks...

My Kerbin Sphere Tug "Ea" for shuttling things to and from my Minmas refinery ship.

One of the fuel transfer modules that is towed.

Finally "Anshar" fuel depot, in LKO, 20K of all three resources minimum.

This may have been answered somewhere in the last 24 pages, but regarding the large spherical tank - Why does it hold so much fuel? based on relative size in game it looks like it should be closer to 10000 units than over 17000. (with similar ratios on the oxidizer of course)

This may have been answered somewhere in the last 24 pages, but regarding the large spherical tank - Why does it hold so much fuel? based on relative size in game it looks like it should be closer to 10000 units than over 17000. (with similar ratios on the oxidizer of course)

A lot of math has gone into configuring the amount of resources contained in these spherical tanks, and it is all available in this thread yes

Much of it can be found in the pages surrounding this post, which is a good summary of the end of it calculations.

.http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/30673-0-20-0-Spherical-Fuel-Tank-%28v1-6%29?p=406987&viewfull=1#post406987

TL;DMath - Spheres are missleadingly much much larger than cylinders.

Edited July 16, 2013 by Greys
this indeed looks pretty cool

Yep, i love this pack. I've already put the ridiculously massive 96000u kethane tank to good use I'm currently thinking about landing one at my EPL base on Duna so i never have to worry about running out of storage room..haha

dave4002000: you have an EPL base at Duna and want to land a monster tank there?!? (14t of clumsiness) Build it on Duna (on wheels (or better, tracks) if necessary) and then just move it to a convenient spot.

Heck, just this morning I was thinking about how to get a launch pad to Minmus (I did come up with a launcher that worked, but ick) and then I realized I could use the OC mod to build one in Minmus orbit, and then I need only land it (though if OC supports landed construction...).
yeah I do my kethane refining in orbit, as kethane is lighter than fuel/oxidiser now (AFAIK) so I use the jumbo cylinder as part of my miner and ferry that up to my minmas orbit refinery.

taniwha, i don't have a launchpad or runway out there yet..just a couple of mining rigs. I did manage to get a large tank setup out there, though. Just posted the pics: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/24533-Show-off-your-awesome-KSP-pictures!?p=522547&viewfull=1#post522547

dave4002000: so fly out a modified SpaceDock I've just posted a ModuleManager config fragment to the orbital construction thread, but here it is anyway. It makes the SpaceDock convert RocketParts to SpareParts (adding another entry to go the other way would be trivial).


@PART[SpaceDock] {
    MODULE {
        name = KethaneConverter
        SourceResource = RocketParts
        TargetResource = SpareParts
        ConversionEfficiency = 1
        SourceConsumption = 2
        PowerConsumption = 10
    }
}

Yep, i love this pack. I've already put the ridiculously massive 96000u kethane tank to good use I'm currently thinking about landing one at my EPL base on Duna so i never have to worry about running out of storage room..haha

Haha yea ive got a base im building on minimus. I currently have one of those huge kethane tanks, plan to have 3, and i attached green nav lights to it, when the sun is hidden the base looks freaking awesome thanks to these tanks. (Landing them was kind of a bear, not to mention relocating them with a crane with next to no gravity, Im able to land them about 1 km away from my base consistantly)

dave4002000: so fly out a modified SpaceDock I've just posted a ModuleManager config fragment to the orbital construction thread, but here it is anyway. It makes the SpaceDock convert RocketParts to SpareParts (adding another entry to go the other way would be trivial).

Oh, don't get me wrong. I know there are plenty of easier ways to do it. I just wanted to see if i could actually figure out out a way to land 70tons of storage tanks on Duna..haha
Ah, well now, that is a completely different story, isn't it? Enjoy the challenge and good luck!

Hey Talisar, can you add tanks with 3.75m and 5m attachment points? I want fueltanks for my latest concept, the KEV-010 Kadmos II (Named in honor of the AAR that featured a craft of similar name, also powered with a Z-Pinch fusion engine, link here http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/27214-AAR-Jool-of-Kerbol-system-or-There-and-Back-Again?highlight=Jool ) I don't have picks, but that's because I need a part. And such a spherical tank would give me massive amounts of DeltaV. Not that I am directly requesting custom fueltanks, just requesting (at the very least) some advice on how to mod the .cfg for the current largest one of these tanks and make it MUCH bigger. Cuz bigger is better!

Edited July 20, 2013 by Fox62
Fox62: If you scale the tanks by "x", then you need to scale the mass and resource amounts by x-cubed. (eg, scale tank by 2, scale mass/resources by 2^3 = 8).
Also can you please rescaled the weights of the different radial adapters? they shouldnt all be 2.5 mass units. otherwise one of my fav mods in game.
Taniwha, I'm asking what I will need to rescale the largest tank BY to make the endcaps 3.75m and 5m.
